This Game is a Good game to pass time. I suggest playing with friends since this game can be more fun with Friends. 

9/10

I've put over 125 hours into this game at this point, both playing from a competitive standpoint and playing custom games with different friend groups. Here are my thoughts:

8/10: Gameplay Premise - Matches in this game feel incredible (when matchmaking works well, that is). Playing as survivor and killer feel totally different, so I will be describing them separately.

As Survivor, this game feels somewhere between a mix of a capture point and a stealth game, combined with intense levels of cooperation. While playing alone is doable, playing Survivor with at least one other friend is much more exciting. Since there's numerous objectives that the survivors have to complete (Completing Generators, Healing others, Saving Teammates, Distracting the Killer) you can find a playstyle and build that fits your preference. I wouldn't call DBD a "Scary" game for the survivors, but it certainly can get intense, especially against certain killers that are hard to keep track of. The biggest drawback of playing as survivor is, like any team game, you are reliant on your teammates. If you have a full group, then that's no problem, but nothing ruins a game faster than a teammate that trolls/disconnects/etc etc

While I've heard people describe playing Killer as "Hunting Down" survivors, I feel like that doesn't fully describe the main experience. As an Iridescent Rank 1 Killer, the real challenge from Killer comes from quick decision making. Sure, you could simply run after every survivor you see, but you'll quickly find that just leads to you getting lead into pallet after pallet till everyone escapes. Instead, think of Killer more as a mixture of time management and decision making. Every second you're not impeding them, the survivors are working to complete their objective, so you have to make their lives a living hell. If you can keep all four of them distracted and busy healing/saving allies/running away, you'll do much better than the guy that just chases after the same one guy for 30 minutes. The way the game is made, you are rewarded for playing like a horror movie Killer actually would: Threatening, Unpredictable, and Relentless. And it's damn fun. 

3/10: Ease of Learning - I didn't look up much of anything about DBD before I started playing. In fact, I didn't even know what it was beyond just being a "cooperative horror game." The in game tutorial does a decent job at explaining the basics of how to play, but for new players there is certainly a learning curve. This isn't the kind of game that you'd want to jump right in without either a more experienced friend with you or having watched a video online. Going in blind as Survivor is just going to make you and your teammates frustrated and if you go in blind as Killer you're going to get bullied. Yet, once you get over the information overload that comes from just how many different perks/items there are and how they are used, you'll not only have a fun time using them, but thinking of new combinations and strategies, especially on the killer side

2/10: Progression - Personally, I do not like the Bloodweb system for perks and items. While I feel like from a gameplay perspective it certainly encourages the player to keep playing, it stifles new players rather harshly by blocking them from getting the perks they want to use and it prevents creativity by forcing a player to spend dozens of hours grinding just to run one niche build. I'm unsure what it should be replaced with, but it's certainly not a dealbreaker by any means. 

6/10: Community/Other Players - The community for this game can be very toxic. However, I've also found that unlike a game like League of Legends, people push back against toxicity very harshly. Since there is very little communication in this game beyond text chat before/after matches, it doesn't really matter much. Overall, you'll get a toxic player or a troll here and there, but you'll also find just as many people that make the game even more interesting.


Overall, this game is great. I'd give it an overall rating of  "Buy On Sale," if you're alone but if you have a group of friends that love cooperative competitive games, then it's worth full price too. 




Also give Pinhead back his voicelines

This game will swallow your soul

I'm so addicted to this game right now - it's insane.  I love how the sessions are fairly short and I feel like I always get a really good variety of gameplay between the different maps and killers.  The Bloodpoints/perks also make progressing in the game enjoyable.  Overall I really like the mechanics for the controls - might just be me, but I really feel like the controls/camera is very similar to Resident Evil (RE2 / Village).  And I played RE2 3x over.  So this for me is great lol.  I think the saddest part to me is they reset ranking every month T___T.
Great game. I like when the humans scream and are on the hook. I think they look funny when they are full of blood. Sadly, the game isn't so scary.

Only play it with friends! If you do not play with friends, you are either d-u-m-b or a masochist, because the amount of st-up-dity within this game is unmeasureable, just like the toxic behaviour of many people of this community! The devs ain't care about anything and a new patch is always a new way to mess with everyone! Matchmaking system? Sure as a beginner just go on and get sre-wed over by the pros because, why matching you with someone of your skill level (as killer)?! But if you dare to play as a surviovr with random people, you only get paired with the worst people possible! Serously, either play with friends or never ever think of buying this game, because it will be a huge waste of money and time if you play alone!
Buy this if you like feeling like you lost even tho you won.
Really fun game! Not really scary but has lots of references to horror movies.

This game is full of cringe beta weebs.  In my opinion, everything about anime is mega cringe. The story arcs, the music, the characters, the obsessed fans, the over-sexualization of female characters etc....just everything. From the monumentally unrealistic social interactions to the dreadful, pedo vibes of certain characters and fans, I get shivers just thinking about anime.  Just playing this game sometimes gives me the creeps when I see grown adults wishing they could marry and procreate with cartoon characters.

Please do something about that weeb pandemic otherwise I see no future for the game.

Dead By Daylight is a great game , here is why,,,

Awesome intense chases between survivor and killer

Unique BLOOD WEB ranking system

Devs are constantly adding new content

You can play solo or with friends

Addictive gameplay 

survivor / killer ranking system which puts you with similar skilled players (needs some work tho)

has popular horror franchise characters in the game

Negatives...

Ranking system needs to be improved a bit 

matchmaking needs ti be improved for killer and survivor , sometimes i end up waiting ten mins for a match (not often)

I'm going to be completely and brutally honest here. I. Love. This. Game. However there is too much plaguing this game for me to honestly give this a good review. Hackers are rampant in high ranks, and the devs think Skill Based Matchmaking is more important than fixing the issues with hackers and the fact that the game is literally unplayable on consoles now. Again. I love this game. But it's just not fun anymore. Hackers have gotten to the point to where streaming this game as a killer with TTV in your name (or survivor for that matter), they will steal your IGN and spam racial and homophobic slurs USING YOUR DAMN NAME. BHVR I BEG YOU TO PLEASE. FOR ONCE. LOOK AT WHAT YOUR COMMUNITY, ESPECIALLY YOUR TOP CONTENT CREATORS, ARE ASKING FOR. THEY LOVE THIS GAME MORE THAN I DO. THEY USED TO PLAY IT EVERY DAMN DAY. BUT NOW THEY CAN'T BECAUSE MOST OF THE TIME THEIR TWITCH ACCOUNTS ARE AT RISK IF THEY RUN INTO A HACKER. PLEASE. FIX. YOUR. SHIT.
mhmm.. if you want to suffer the hole time buy it it' really good xD

Dead by Daylight es un gran juego multijugador en el cual la pase muy bien jugando con amigos. Es un juego que al principio da miedo pero a las 3 partidas te cagas de risa trolleando en la partida. Es muy divertido jugar como los sobrevivientes y a√∫n m√°s jugando con los iconicos villanos de las peliculas y videojuegos. Algo que le criticaria es que para tener las mejores habilidades hay que o farmear bastante tiempo o comprar los dlc, sin embargo esto no lo hace pay to win y es muy disfrutable al principio tambien. Tambien se nota que los desarrolladores siguen tratando de mejorar y expandir el juego constantemente y muy probablemente siga siendo asi por un tiempo. Calificai√≥n: 8/10
